title: CN Level 2 â€” OSI & TCP/IP Models
concept: Layered architecture, OSI 7-layer model, TCP/IP model and mapping protocols to layers.

challenges.title: Q1: OSI Layers Count
examples:
Options:
 a) 4 layers
 b) 5 layers
 c) 7 layers
 d) 8 layers

challenges.title: Q2: TCP/IP Layers
challenges.description: The TCP/IP reference model typically has:
examples:
Options:
 a) 2 layers
 b) 3 layers
 c) 4 layers
 d) 7 layers

challenges.title: Q3: HTTP Layer
challenges.description: In the OSI/TCP-IP models, HTTP is considered an example of a protocol at the:
examples:
Options:
 a) Physical layer
 b) Network layer
 c) Transport layer
 d) Application layer

challenges.title: Q4: Layer Ordering
challenges.description: Which of the following lists OSI layers in the correct order from bottom (closest to hardware) to top (closest to user)?
examples:
Options:
 a) Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
 b) Application, Presentation, Session, Transport, Network, Data Link, Physical
 c) Data Link, Physical, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application
 d) Network, Data Link, Physical, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application

challenges.title: Q5: Service of Transport Layer
challenges.description: Which service is primarily provided by the transport layer to the upper layers?
examples:
Options:
 a) Routing between networks
 b) End-to-end process-to-process communication
 c) Physical signalling over the medium
 d) Name to IP address resolution
